intro: Tibouchina pseudomollis, commonly known as the pink mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant pink or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with glossy, oval-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Tibouchina pseudomollis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun.
